intro: Wallichia orania, commonly known as the Orania wallflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant for gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
